peripheral.name: I2C
peripheral.description: Product name title=UM10375 Chapter title=LPC13xx I2C-bus controller Modification date=4/19/2011 Major revision=2 Minor revision=1

register.name: CONSET
register.description: I2C Control Set Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is set. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: AA
field.description: Assert acknowledge flag.

field.name: SI
field.description: I2C interrupt flag.

field.name: STO
field.description: STOP flag.

field.name: STA
field.description: START flag.

field.name: I2EN
field.description: I2C interface enable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: STAT
register.description: I2C Status Register. During I2C operation, this register provides detailed status codes that allow software to determine the next action needed.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: These bits are unused and are always 0.

field.name: Status
field.description: These bits give the actual status information about the I 2C interface.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: DAT
register.description: I2C Data Register. During master or slave transmit mode, data to be transmitted is written to this register. During master or slave receive mode, data that has been received may be read from this register.

field.name: Data
field.description: This register holds data values that have been received or are to be transmitted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: ADR0
register.description: I2C Slave Address Register 0. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

field.name: GC
field.description: General Call enable bit.

field.name: Address
field.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: SCLH
register.description: SCH Duty Cycle Register High Half Word. Determines the high time of the I2C clock.

field.name: SCLH
field.description: Count for SCL HIGH time period selection.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: SCLL
register.description: SCL Duty Cycle Register Low Half Word. Determines the low time of the I2C clock. I2nSCLL and I2nSCLH together determine the clock frequency generated by an I2C master and certain times used in slave mode.

field.name: SCLL
field.description: Count for SCL low time period selection.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: CONCLR
register.description: I2C Control Clear Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is cleared. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: AAC
field.description: Assert acknowledge Clear bit.

field.name: SIC
field.description: I2C interrupt Clear bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: STAC
field.description: START flag Clear bit.

field.name: I2ENC
field.description: I2C interface Disable bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: MM_ENA
field.description: Monitor mode enable.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The I 2C module will enter monitor mode. In this mode the SDA output will be forced high. This will prevent the I2C module from outputting data of any kind (including ACK) onto the I2C data bus. Depending on the state of the ENA_SCL bit, the output may be also forced high, preventing the module from having control over the I2C clock line.

field.name: ENA_SCL
field.description: SCL output enable.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: When this bit is cleared to 0, the SCL output will be forced high when the module is in monitor mode. As described above, this will prevent the module from having any control over the I2C clock line.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: When this bit is set, the I2C module may exercise the same control over the clock line that it would in normal operation. This means that, acting as a slave peripheral, the I2C module can stretch the clock line (hold it low) until it has had time to respond to an I2C interrupt.[1]

field.name: MATCH_ALL
field.description: Select interrupt register match.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: When this bit is cleared, an interrupt will only be generated when a match occurs to one of the (up-to) four address registers described above. That is, the module will respond as a normal slave as far as address-recognition is concerned.

enumeratedValue.name: ANYINT
enumeratedValue.description: When this bit is set to 1 and the I 2C is in monitor mode, an interrupt will be generated on ANY address received. This will enable the part to monitor all traffic on the bus.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is not defined.

register.name: ADR%s
register.description: I2C Slave Address Register 1. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

field.name: GC
field.description: General Call enable bit.

field.name: Address
field.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: DATA_BUFFER
register.description: Data buffer register. The contents of the 8 MSBs of the I2DAT shift register will be transferred to the DATA_BUFFER automatically after every nine bits (8 bits of data plus ACK or NACK) has been received on the bus.

field.name: Data
field.description: This register holds contents of the 8 MSBs of the I2DAT shift register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: MASK%s
register.description: I2C Slave address mask register n. This mask register is associated with I2ADRn to determine an address match. The mask register has no effect when comparing to the General Call address (0000000).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

field.name: MASK
field.description: Mask bits.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is undefined.

peripheral.name: WWDT
peripheral.description: Product name title=UM10375 Chapter title=LPC13xx Windowed WatchDog Timer (WWDT) Modification date=4/19/2011 Major revision=2 Minor revision=1

register.name: MOD
register.description: Watchdog mode register. This register contains the basic mode and status of the Watchdog Timer.

field.name: WDEN
field.description: Watchdog enable bit. This bit is Set Only. Remark: Setting this bit to one also locks the watchdog clock source. Once the watchdog timer is enabled, the watchdog timer clock source cannot be changed. If the watchdog timer is needed in Deep-sleep mode, the watchdog clock source must be changed to watchdog oscillator before setting this bit to one.

field.name: WDRESET
field.description: Watchdog reset enable bit. This bit is Set Only.

enumeratedValue.name: RESET
enumeratedValue.description: A watchdog timeout will not cause a chip reset.

enumeratedValue.name: INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: A watchdog timeout will cause a chip reset.

field.name: WDTOF
field.description: Watchdog time-out flag. Set when the watchdog timer times out, by a feed error, or by events associated with WDPROTECT, cleared by software. Causes a chip reset if WDRESET = 1.

field.name: WDINT
field.description: Watchdog interrupt flag. Set when the timer reaches the value in WDWARNINT. Cleared by software.

field.name: WDPROTECT
field.description: Watchdog update mode. This bit is Set Only.

enumeratedValue.name: ANYTIME
enumeratedValue.description: The watchdog reload value (WDTC) can be changed at any time.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: The watchdog reload value (WDTC) can be changed only after the counter is below the value of WDWARNINT and WDWINDOW. Note: this mode is intended for use only when WDRESET =1.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: TC
register.description: Watchdog timer constant register. This register determines the time-out value.

field.name: Count
field.description: Watchdog time-out interval.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: FEED
register.description: Watchdog feed sequence register. Writing 0xAA followed by 0x55 to this register reloads the Watchdog timer with the value contained in WDTC.

field.name: Feed
field.description: Feed value should be 0xAA followed by 0x55.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: TV
register.description: Watchdog timer value register. This register reads out the current value of the Watchdog timer.

field.name: Count
field.description: Counter timer value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: WARNINT
field.description: Watchdog warning interrupt compare value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: WINDOW
field.description: Watchdog window value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

peripheral.name: UART
peripheral.description: Product name title=UM10375 Chapter title=LPC13xx UART Modification date=4/19/2011 Major revision=2 Minor revision=1

register.name: RBR
register.description: Receiver Buffer Register. Contains the next received character to be read. When DLAB=0.

field.name: RBR
field.description: The UART Receiver Buffer Register contains the oldest received byte in the UART RX FIFO.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: THR
register.description: Transmit Holding Register. The next character to be transmitted is written here. When DLAB=0.

field.name: THR
field.description: Writing to the UART Transmit Holding Register causes the data to be stored in the UART transmit FIFO. The byte will be sent when it reaches the bottom of the FIFO and the transmitter is available.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: DLL
register.description: Divisor Latch LSB. Least significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider. When DLAB=1.

field.name: DLLSB
field.description: The UART Divisor Latch LSB Register, along with the DLM register, determines the baud rate of the UART.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: DLM
register.description: Divisor Latch MSB. Most significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider. When DLAB=1.

field.name: DLMSB
field.description: The UART Divisor Latch MSB Register, along with the DLL register, determines the baud rate of the UART.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: IER
register.description: Interrupt Enable Register. Contains individual interrupt enable bits for the 7 potential UART interrupts. When DLAB=0.

field.name: RBRIE
field.description: Interrupt Enable. Enables the Receive Data Available interrupt for UART. It also controls the Character Receive Time-out interrupt.

field.name: THREIE
field.description: Interrupt Enable. Enables the THRE interrupt for UART. The status of this interrupt can be read from LSR[5].

field.name: RXLIE
field.description: Line Interrupt Enable. Enables the UART RX line status interrupts. The status of this interrupt can be read from LSR[4:1].

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Disable the RX line status interrupts.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Enable the RX line status interrupts.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: ABEOINTEN
field.description: Enables the end of auto-baud interrupt.

field.name: ABTOINTEN
field.description: Enables the auto-baud time-out interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: IIR
register.description: Interrupt ID Register. Identifies which interrupt(s) are pending.

field.name: INTSTATUS
field.description: Interrupt status. Note that IIR[0] is active low. The pending interrupt can be determined by evaluating IIR[3:1].

enumeratedValue.name: INT
enumeratedValue.description: At least one interrupt is pending.

field.name: INTID
field.description: Interrupt identification. IER[3:1] identifies an interrupt corresponding to the UART Rx FIFO. All other combinations of IER[3:1] not listed below are reserved (100,101,111).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: FIFOEN
field.description: These bits are equivalent to FCR[0].

field.name: ABEOINT
field.description: End of auto-baud interrupt. True if auto-baud has finished successfully and interrupt is enabled.

field.name: ABTOINT
field.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt. True if auto-baud has timed out and interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: FCR
register.description: FIFO Control Register. Controls UART FIFO usage and modes.

field.name: FIFOEN
field.description: FIFO Enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: UART FIFOs are disabled. Must not be used in the application.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Active high enable for both UART Rx and TX FIFOs and FCR[7:1] access. This bit must be set for proper UART operation. Any transition on this bit will automatically clear the UART FIFOs.

field.name: RXFIFOR
field.description: RX FIFO Reset

enumeratedValue.name: NOACTION
enumeratedValue.description: No impact on either of UART FIFOs.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Writing a logic 1 to FCR[1] will clear all bytes in UART Rx FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

field.name: TXFIFOR
field.description: TX FIFO Reset

enumeratedValue.name: NOACTION
enumeratedValue.description: No impact on either of UART FIFOs.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Writing a logic 1 to FCR[2] will clear all bytes in UART TX FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RXTLVL
field.description: RX Trigger Level. These two bits determine how many receiver UART FIFO characters must be written before an interrupt is activated.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: LCR
register.description: Line Control Register. Contains controls for frame formatting and break generation.

field.name: WLS
field.description: Word Length Select

field.name: SBS
field.description: Stop Bit Select

field.name: PE
field.description: Parity Enable

field.name: PS
field.description: Parity Select

enumeratedValue.name: ODD_PARITY_NUMBER_O
enumeratedValue.description: Odd parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be odd.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN_PARITY_NUMBER_
enumeratedValue.description: Even Parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be even.

field.name: BC
field.description: Break Control

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE_BREAK_TRANSMI
enumeratedValue.description: Enable break transmission. Output pin UART TXD is forced to logic 0 when LCR[6] is active high.

field.name: DLAB
field.description: Divisor Latch Access Bit (DLAB)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DTRCTRL
field.description: Source for modem output pin, DTR. This bit reads as 0 when modem loopback mode is active.

field.name: RTSCTRL
field.description: Source for modem output pin RTS. This bit reads as 0 when modem loopback mode is active.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: LMS
field.description: Loopback Mode Select. The modem loopback mode provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing. Serial data from the transmitter is connected internally to serial input of the receiver. Input pin, RXD, has no effect on loopback and output pin, TXD is held in marking state. The four modem inputs (CTS, DSR, RI and DCD) are disconnected externally. Externally, the modem outputs (RTS, DTR) are set inactive. Internally, the four modem outputs are connected to the four modem inputs. As a result of these connections, the upper four bits of the MSR will be driven by the lower four bits of the MCR rather than the four modem inputs in normal mode. This permits modem status interrupts to be generated in loopback mode by writing the lower four bits of MCR.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RTSEN
field.description: RTS enable

field.name: CTSEN
field.description: CTS enable

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: LSR
register.description: Line Status Register. Contains flags for transmit and receive status, including line errors.

field.name: RDR
field.description: Receiver Data Ready. LSR[0] is set when the RBR holds an unread character and is cleared when the UART RBR FIFO is empty.

field.name: OE
field.description: Overrun Error. The overrun error condition is set as soon as it occurs. A LSR read clears LSR[1]. LSR[1] is set when UART RSR has a new character assembled and the UART RBR FIFO is full. In this case, the UART RBR FIFO will not be overwritten and the character in the UART RSR will be lost.

field.name: PE
field.description: Parity Error. When the parity bit of a received character is in the wrong state, a parity error occurs. A LSR read clears LSR[2]. Time of parity error detection is dependent on FCR[0]. Note: A parity error is associated with the character at the top of the UART RBR FIFO.

field.name: FE
field.description: Framing Error. When the stop bit of a received character is a logic 0, a framing error occurs. A LSR read clears LSR[3]. The time of the framing error detection is dependent on FCR0. Upon detection of a framing error, the RX will attempt to re-synchronize to the data and assume that the bad stop bit is actually an early start bit. However, it cannot be assumed that the next received byte will be correct even if there is no Framing Error. Note: A framing error is associated with the character at the top of the UART RBR FIFO.

field.name: BI
field.description: Break Interrupt. When RXD1 is held in the spacing state (all zeros) for one full character transmission (start, data, parity, stop), a break interrupt occurs. Once the break condition has been detected, the receiver goes idle until RXD1 goes to marking state (all ones). A LSR read clears this status bit. The time of break detection is dependent on FCR[0]. Note: The break interrupt is associated with the character at the top of the UART RBR FIFO.

field.name: THRE
field.description: Transmitter Holding Register Empty. THRE is set immediately upon detection of an empty UART THR and is cleared on a THR write.

field.name: TEMT
field.description: Transmitter Empty. TEMT is set when both THR and TSR are empty; TEMT is cleared when either the TSR or the THR contain valid data.

enumeratedValue.name: VALID
enumeratedValue.description: THR and/or the TSR contains valid data.

enumeratedValue.name: EMPTY
enumeratedValue.description: THR and the TSR are empty.

field.name: RXFE
field.description: Error in RX FIFO. LSR[7] is set when a character with a RX error such as framing error, parity error or break interrupt, is loaded into the RBR. This bit is cleared when the LSR register is read and there are no subsequent errors in the UART FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: NOERROR
enumeratedValue.description: RBR contains no UART RX errors or FCR[0]=0.

enumeratedValue.name: ERRORS
enumeratedValue.description: UART RBR contains at least one UART RX error.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: Set upon state change of input CTS. Cleared on a MSR read.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_STATE_CHANGE
enumeratedValue.description: No change detected on modem input CTS.

enumeratedValue.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
enumeratedValue.description: State change detected on modem input CTS.

field.name: DELTADSR
field.description: Set upon state change of input DSR. Cleared on a MSR read.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_STATE_CHANGE
enumeratedValue.description: No change detected on modem input DSR.

enumeratedValue.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
enumeratedValue.description: State change detected on modem input DSR.

field.name: TERI
field.description: Trailing Edge RI. Set upon low to high transition of input RI. Cleared on a MSR read.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_STATE_CHANGE
enumeratedValue.description: No change detected on modem input, RI.

field.name: DELTADCD
field.description: Set upon state change of input DCD. Cleared on a MSR read.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_STATE_CHANGE
enumeratedValue.description: No change detected on modem input DCD.

enumeratedValue.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
enumeratedValue.description: State change detected on modem input DCD.

field.name: CTS
field.description: Clear To Send State. Complement of input signal CTS. This bit is connected to MCR[1] in modem loopback mode.

field.name: DSR
field.description: Data Set Ready State. Complement of input signal DSR. This bit is connected to MCR[0] in modem loopback mode.

field.name: RI
field.description: Ring Indicator State. Complement of input RI. This bit is connected to MCR[2] in modem loopback mode.

field.name: DCD
field.description: Data Carrier Detect State. Complement of input DCD. This bit is connected to MCR[3] in modem loopback mode.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: SCR
register.description: Scratch Pad Register. Eight-bit temporary storage for software.

field.name: Pad
field.description: A readable, writable byte.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: ACR
register.description: Auto-baud Control Register. Contains controls for the auto-baud feature.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_BAUD_START_AUT
enumeratedValue.description: Auto-baud start (auto-baud is running). Auto-baud run bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Auto-baud mode select bit.

field.name: AUTORESTART
field.description: Auto restart

enumeratedValue.name: RESTART_IN_CASE_OF_T
enumeratedValue.description: Restart in case of time-out (counter restarts at next UART Rx falling edge)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: ABEOINTCLR
field.description: End of auto-baud interrupt clear bit (write only accessible).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

field.name: ABTOINTCLR
field.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt clear bit (write only accessible).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: FDR
register.description: Fractional Divider Register. Generates a clock input for the baud rate divider.

field.name: DIVADDVAL
field.description: Baud rate generation pre-scaler divisor value. If this field is 0, fractional baud rate generator will not impact the UART baud rate.

field.name: MULVAL
field.description: Baud rate pre-scaler multiplier value. This field must be greater or equal 1 for UART to operate properly, regardless of whether the fractional baud rate generator is used or not.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: TER
register.description: Transmit Enable Register. Turns off UART transmitter for use with software flow control.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: TXEN
field.description: When this bit is 1, as it is after a Reset, data written to the THR is output on the TXD pin as soon as any preceding data has been sent. If this bit cleared to 0 while a character is being sent, the transmission of that character is completed, but no further characters are sent until this bit is set again. In other words, a 0 in this bit blocks the transfer of characters from the THR or TX FIFO into the transmit shift register. Software can clear this bit when it detects that the a hardware-handshaking TX-permit signal (CTS) has gone false, or with software handshaking, when it receives an XOFF character (DC3). Software can set this bit again when it detects that the TX-permit signal has gone true, or when it receives an XON (DC1) character.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: RS485CTRL
register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Control. Contains controls to configure various aspects of RS-485/EIA-485 modes.

field.name: NMMEN
field.description: NMM enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is enabled. In this mode, an address is detected when a received byte causes the UART to set the parity error and generate an interrupt.

field.name: RXDIS
field.description: Receiver enable

field.name: AADEN
field.description: AAD enable

field.name: SEL
field.description: Direction control pins select

enumeratedValue.name: RTS
enumeratedValue.description: If direction control is enabled (bit DCTRL = 1), pin RTS is used for direction control.

enumeratedValue.name: DTR
enumeratedValue.description: If direction control is enabled (bit DCTRL = 1), pin DTR is used for direction control.

field.name: DCTRL
field.description: Direction control enable

field.name: OINV
field.description: This bit reverses the polarity of the direction control signal on the RTS (or DTR) pin.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 0 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 1 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 1 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 0 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: RS485ADRMATCH
register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 address match. Contains the address match value for RS-485/EIA-485 mode.

field.name: ADRMATCH
field.description: Contains the address match value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DLY
field.description: Contains the direction control (RTS or DTR) delay value. This register works in conjunction with an 8-bit counter.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

peripheral.name: CT16B0
peripheral.description: Product name title=UM10375 Chapter title=LPC13xx 16-bit timer/counters (CT16B0/1) Modification date=4/19/2011 Major revision=2 Minor revision=1

register.name: BIR
register.description: Interrupt Register (IR). The IR can be written to clear interrupts. The IR can be read to identify which of five possible interrupt sources are pending.

field.name: MR0INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 0.

field.name: MR1INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 1.

field.name: MR2INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 2.

field.name: MR3INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for match channel 3.

field.name: CR0INT
field.description: Interrupt flag for capture channel 0 event.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: BTCR
register.description: Timer Control Register (TCR). The TCR is used to control the Timer Counter functions. The Timer Counter can be disabled or reset through the TCR.

field.name: CEN
field.description: When one, the Timer Counter and Prescale Counter are enabled for counting. When zero, the counters are disabled.

field.name: CRESET
field.description: When one, the Timer Counter and the Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until TCR[1] is returned to zero.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: BTC
register.description: Timer Counter (TC). The 16-bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

field.name: TC
field.description: Timer counter value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: BPR
register.description: Prescale Register (PR). When the Prescale Counter (below) is equal to this value, the next clock increments the TC and clears the PC.

field.name: PR
field.description: Prescale max value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: BPC
register.description: Prescale Counter (PC). The 16-bit PC is a counter which is incremented to the value stored in PR. When the value in PR is reached, the TC is incremented and the PC is cleared. The PC is observable and controllable through the bus interface.

field.name: PC
field.description: Prescale counter value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: BMCR
register.description: Match Control Register (MCR). The MCR is used to control if an interrupt is generated and if the TC is reset when a Match occurs.

field.name: MR0I
field.description: Interrupt on MR0: an interrupt is generated when MR0 matches the value in the TC.

field.name: MR0R
field.description: Reset on MR0: the TC will be reset if MR0 matches it.

field.name: MR0S
field.description: Stop on MR0: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR0 matches the TC.

field.name: MR1I
field.description: Interrupt on MR1: an interrupt is generated when MR1 matches the value in the TC.

field.name: MR1R
field.description: Reset on MR1: the TC will be reset if MR1 matches it.

field.name: MR1S
field.description: Stop on MR1: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR1 matches the TC.

field.name: MR2I
field.description: Interrupt on MR2: an interrupt is generated when MR2 matches the value in the TC.

field.name: MR2R
field.description: Reset on MR2: the TC will be reset if MR2 matches it.

field.name: MR2S
field.description: Stop on MR2: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR2 matches the TC.

field.name: MR3I
field.description: Interrupt on MR3: an interrupt is generated when MR3 matches the value in the TC.

field.name: MR3R
field.description: Reset on MR3: the TC will be reset if MR3 matches it.

field.name: MR3S
field.description: Stop on MR3: the TC and PC will be stopped and TCR[0] will be set to 0 if MR3 matches the TC.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: BMR%s
register.description: Match Register 0 (MR0). MR0 can be enabled through the MCR to reset the TC, stop both the TC and PC, and/or generate an interrupt every time MR0 matches the TC.

field.name: MATCH
field.description: Timer counter match value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: BCCR
register.description: Capture Control Register (CCR). The CCR controls which edges of the capture inputs are used to load the Capture Registers and whether or not an interrupt is generated when a capture takes place.

field.name: CAP0RE
field.description: Capture on CT16Bn_CAP0 rising edge: a sequence of 0 then 1 on CT16Bn_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

field.name: CAP0FE
field.description: Capture on CT16Bn_CAP0 falling edge: a sequence of 1 then 0 on CT16Bn_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

field.name: CAP0I
field.description: Interrupt on CT16Bn_CAP0 event: a CR0 load due to a CT16Bn_CAP0 event will generate an interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: BCR0
register.description: Capture Register 0 (CR0). CR0 is loaded with the value of TC when there is an event on the CT16B0_CAP0 input.

field.name: CAP
field.description: Timer counter capture value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: BEMR
register.description: External Match Register (EMR). The EMR controls the match function and the external match pins CT16B0_MAT[2:0].

field.name: EM0
field.description: External Match 0. This bit reflects the state of output CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[5:4] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

field.name: EM1
field.description: External Match 1. This bit reflects the state of output CT16B0_MAT1/CT16B1_MAT1, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[7:6] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT16B0_MAT1/CT16B1_MAT1 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

field.name: EM2
field.description: External Match 2. This bit reflects the state of output match channel 2, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[9:8] control the functionality of this output. Note that on counter/timer 0 this match channel is not pinned out. This bit is driven to the CT16B1_MAT2 pin if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

field.name: EM3
field.description: External Match 3. This bit reflects the state of output of match channel 3. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[11:10] control the functionality of this output. There is no output pin available for this channel on either of the 16-bit timers.

field.name: EMC0
field.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
enumeratedValue.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MATm pin is LOW if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
enumeratedValue.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MATm pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
enumeratedValue.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

field.name: EMC1
field.description: External Match Control 1. Determines the functionality of External Match 1.

enumeratedValue.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MATm pin is LOW if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MATm pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
enumeratedValue.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

field.name: EMC2
field.description: External Match Control 2. Determines the functionality of External Match 2.

enumeratedValue.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bn_MATm pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bn_MATm pin is LOW if pinned out).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: BCTCR
register.description: Count Control Register (CTCR). The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

field.name: CTM
field.description: Counter/Timer Mode. This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC).

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

enumeratedValue.name: RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

enumeratedValue.name: BOTHEDGES
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

field.name: CIS
field.description: Count Input Select. In counter mode (when bits 1:0 in this register are not 00), these bits select which CAP pin is sampled for clocking. Note: If Counter mode is selected in the CTCR register, bits 2:0 in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: BPWMC
register.description: PWM Control Register (PWMCON). The PWMCON enables PWM mode for the external match pins CT16B0_MAT[2:0].

field.name: PWMEN0
field.description: PWM channel0 enable

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT0.

field.name: PWMEN1
field.description: PWM channel1 enable

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT16Bn_MAT1.

field.name: PWMEN2
field.description: PWM channel2 enable

enumeratedValue.name: EM2
enumeratedValue.description: Match channel 2 or pin CT16B0_MAT2 is controlled by EM2. Match channel 2 is not pinned out on timer 1.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: PWM mode is enabled for match channel 2 or pin CT16B0_MAT2.

field.name: PWMEN3
field.description: PWM channel3 enable Note: It is recommended to use match channel 3 to set the PWM cycle because it is not pinned out.

enumeratedValue.name: EM3
enumeratedValue.description: Match channel 3 match channel 3 is controlled by EM3.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM
enumeratedValue.description: PWM mode is enabled for match channel 3match channel 3.

peripheral.name: ADC
peripheral.description: Product name title=UM10375 Chapter title=LPC13xx Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) Modification date=4/19/2011 Major revision=2 Minor revision=1

register.name: CR
register.description: A/D Control Register. The AD0CR register must be written to select the operating mode before A/D conversion can occur.

field.name: SEL
field.description: Selects which of the AD7:0 pins is (are) to be sampled and converted. Bit 0 selects Pin AD0, bit 1 selects pin AD1,..., and bit 7 selects pin AD7. In software-controlled mode (BURST = 0), only one channel can be selected, i.e. only one of these bits should be 1. In hardware scan mode (BURST = 1), any numbers of channels can be selected, i.e any or all bits can be set to 1. If all bits are set to 0, channel 0 is selected automatically (SEL = 0x01).

field.name: CLKDIV
field.description: The APB clock (PCLK) is divided by CLKDIV +1 to produce the clock for the ADC, which should be less than or equal to 4.5 MHz. Typically, software should program the smallest value in this field that yields a clock of 4.5 MHz or slightly less, but in certain cases (such as a high-impedance analog source) a slower clock may be desirable.

field.name: BURST
field.description: Burst select

enumeratedValue.name: SOFTWARE_CONTROLLED_
enumeratedValue.description: Software-controlled mode: Conversions are software-controlled and require 11 clocks.

enumeratedValue.name: HARDWARE_SCAN_MODE_
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware scan mode: The AD converter does repeated conversions at the rate selected by the CLKS field, scanning (if necessary) through the pins selected by 1s in the SEL field. The first conversion after the start corresponds to the least-significant bit set to 1 in the SEL field, then the next higher bits (pins) set to 1 are scanned if applicable. Repeated conversions can be terminated by clearing this bit, but the conversion in progress when this bit is cleared will be completed. Important: START bits must be 000 when BURST = 1 or conversions will not start.

field.name: CLKS
field.description: This field selects the number of clocks used for each conversion in Burst mode, and the number of bits of accuracy of the result in the LS bits of ADDR, between 11 clocks (10 bits) and 4 clocks (3 bits).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: START
field.description: When the BURST bit is 0, these bits control whether and when an A/D conversion is started:

enumeratedValue.name: NO_START_THIS_VALUE
enumeratedValue.description: No start (this value should be used when clearing PDN to 0).

enumeratedValue.name: EDGEPIO0_2
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on PIO0_2/SSEL/CT16B0_CAP0.

enumeratedValue.name: EDGEPIO1_5
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on PIO1_5/DIR/CT32B0_CAP0.

enumeratedValue.name: EDGE CT32B0_MAT0

field.name: EDGE
field.description: This bit is significant only when the START field contains 010-111. In these cases:

enumeratedValue.name: RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion on a rising edge on the selected CAP/MAT signal.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion on a falling edge on the selected CAP/MAT signal.

field.name: RESERVED

register.name: GDR
register.description: A/D Global Data Register. Contains the result of the most recent A/D conversion.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: V_VREF
field.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin selected by the SEL field, divided by the voltage on the VDD pin. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VSS, while 0x3FF indicates that the voltage on ADn was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREF.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: CHN
field.description: These bits contain the channel from which the V_VREF bits were converted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: OVERRUN
field.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.

field.name: DONE
field.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read and when the ADCR is written. If the ADCR is written while a conversion is still in progress, this bit is set and a new conversion is started.

register.name: INTEN
register.description: A/D Interrupt Enable Register. This register contains enable bits that allow the DONE flag of each A/D channel to be included or excluded from contributing to the generation of an A/D interrupt.

field.name: ADINTEN0
field.description: These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion. When bit 0 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 0 will generate an interrupt, when bit 1 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 1 will generate an interrupt, etc.

field.name: ADINTEN1
field.description: These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion. When bit 0 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 0 will generate an interrupt, when bit 1 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 1 will generate an interrupt, etc.

field.name: ADINTEN2
field.description: These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion. When bit 0 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 0 will generate an interrupt, when bit 1 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 1 will generate an interrupt, etc.

field.name: ADINTEN3
field.description: These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion. When bit 0 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 0 will generate an interrupt, when bit 1 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 1 will generate an interrupt, etc.

field.name: ADINTEN4
field.description: These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion. When bit 0 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 0 will generate an interrupt, when bit 1 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 1 will generate an interrupt, etc.

field.name: ADINTEN5
field.description: These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion. When bit 0 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 0 will generate an interrupt, when bit 1 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 1 will generate an interrupt, etc.

field.name: ADINTEN6
field.description: These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion. When bit 0 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 0 will generate an interrupt, when bit 1 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 1 will generate an interrupt, etc.

field.name: ADINTEN7
field.description: These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion. When bit 0 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 0 will generate an interrupt, when bit 1 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 1 will generate an interrupt, etc.

field.name: ADGINTEN
field.description: When 1, enables the global DONE flag in ADDR to generate an interrupt. When 0, only the individual A/D channels enabled by ADINTEN 7:0 will generate interrupts.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: DR%s
register.description: A/D Channel n Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel n

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: V_VREF
field.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin, divided by the voltage on the VREF pin. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VREF, while 0x3FF indicates that the voltage on AD input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREF.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: OVERRUN
field.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the V_VREF bits.This bit is cleared by reading this register.

field.name: DONE
field.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read.

register.name: STAT
register.description: A/D Status Register. This register contains DONE and OVERRUN flags for all of the A/D channels, as well as the A/D interrupt flag.

field.name: ADINT
field.description: This bit is the A/D interrupt flag. It is one when any of the individual A/D channel Done flags is asserted and enabled to contribute to the A/D interrupt via the ADINTEN register.

field.name: FRAME
field.description: The frame interrupt occurs every 1 ms. This is used in isochronous packet transfers. 0 = no interrupt. 1 = interrupt pending.

field.name: EP0
field.description: USB core interrupt for physical endpoint 0. 0 = no interrupt. 1 = interrupt pending.

field.name: EP1
field.description: USB core interrupt for physical endpoint 1. 0 = no interrupt. 1 = interrupt pending.

field.name: EP2
field.description: USB core interrupt for physical endpoint 2. 0 = no interrupt. 1 = interrupt pending.

field.name: EP7

field.name: DEV_STAT
field.description: Set when USB Bus reset, USB suspend change, or Connect change event occurs. Refer to Section 10.11.7. 0 = no interrupt. 1 = interrupt pending.

field.name: CC_EMPTY
field.description: The command code register (USBCmdCode) is empty (New command can be written). 0 = no interrupt. 1 = interrupt pending.

field.name: CD_FULL
field.description: Command data register (USBCmdData) is full (Data can be read now). 0 = no interrupt. 1 = interrupt pending.

field.name: RxENDPKT
field.description: The current packet in the endpoint buffer is transferred to the CPU. 0 = no interrupt. 1 = interrupt pending.

field.name: TxENDPKT
field.description: The number of data bytes transferred to the endpoint buffer equals the number of bytes programmed in the TxPacket length register (USBTxPLen). 0 = no interrupt. 1 = interrupt pending.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: CMD_PHASE
field.description: Command phase action

field.name: CODE_WDATA
field.description: This is a multi-purpose field. When CMD_PHASE is Command or Read, this field contains the code for the command (CMD_CODE). When CMD_PHASE is Write, this field contains the command write data (CMD_WDATA).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: CMD_RDATA
field.description: Command Read Data.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RX_DATA
field.description: Data received.

field.name: TX_DATA
field.description: Transmit Data.

field.name: PKT_LNGTH
field.description: The remaining number of bytes to be read from the currently selected endpoint's buffer. When this field decrements to 0, the RxENDPKT bit will be set in USBDevIntSt.

field.name: DV
field.description: Data valid. This bit is useful for isochronous endpoints. Non-isochronous endpoints do not raise an interrupt when an erroneous data packet is received. But invalid data packet can be produced with a bus reset. For isochronous endpoints, data transfer will happen even if an erroneous packet is received. In this case DV bit will not be set for the packet.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: PKT_LNGTH
field.description: The remaining number of bytes to be written to the selected endpoint buffer. This field is decremented by 4 by hardware after each write to USBTxData. When this field decrements to 0, the TxENDPKT bit will be set in USBDevIntSt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RD_EN
field.description: Read mode control. Enables reading data from the OUT endpoint buffer for the endpoint specified in the LOG_ENDPOINT field using the USBRxData register. This bit is cleared by hardware when the last word of the current packet is read from USBRxData.

field.name: WR_EN
field.description: Write mode control. Enables writing data to the IN endpoint buffer for the endpoint specified in the LOG_ENDPOINT field using the USBTxData register. This bit is cleared by hardware when the number of bytes in USBTxLen have been sent.

field.name: LOG_ENDPOINT
field.description: Logical Endpoint number.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: FRAME
field.description: This interrupt comes from a 1 KHz free running clock resynchronized on the incoming SoF tokens. This is to be used for isochronous packet transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: LOWPRIORITY
enumeratedValue.description: FRAME interrupt will be routed to the low-priority interrupt line IRQ.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGHPRIORITY
enumeratedValue.description: FRAME interrupt will be routed to the high-priority interrupt line FIQ.

field.name: BULKOUT
field.description: Interrupt routing for bulk out endpoints For logical endpoint 3 (physical endpoints 6 and 7) only.

enumeratedValue.name: LOWPRIORITY
enumeratedValue.description: BULKOUT interrupt will be routed to the low-priority interrupt line IRQ.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGHPRIORITY
enumeratedValue.description: BULKOUT interrupt will be routed to the high-priority interrupt line FIQ.

field.name: BULKIN

enumeratedValue.description: SSP controller maintains the bus clock low between frames.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: SSP controller maintains the bus clock high between frames.

field.name: CPHA
field.description: Clock Out Phase. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

enumeratedValue.name: FIRSTCLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: SSP controller captures serial data on the first clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition away from the inter-frame state of the clock line.

enumeratedValue.name: SECONDCLOK
enumeratedValue.description: SSP controller captures serial data on the second clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition back to the inter-frame state of the clock line.

field.name: SCR
field.description: Serial Clock Rate. The number of prescaler-output clocks per bit on the bus, minus one. Given that CPSDVSR is the prescale divider, and the APB clock PCLK clocks the prescaler, the bit frequency is PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: CR1
register.description: Control Register 1. Selects master/slave and other modes.

field.name: LBM
field.description: Loop Back Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: OUTPUT
enumeratedValue.description: Serial input is taken from the serial output (MOSI or MISO) rather than the serial input pin (MISO or MOSI respectively).

field.name: SSE
field.description: SSP Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The SSP controller will interact with other devices on the serial bus. Software should write the appropriate control information to the other SSP registers and interrupt controller registers, before setting this bit.

field.name: MS
field.description: Master/Slave Mode.This bit can only be written when the SSE bit is 0.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: The SSP controller acts as a master on the bus, driving the SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines and receiving the MISO line.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE
enumeratedValue.description: The SSP controller acts as a slave on the bus, driving MISO line and receiving SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines.

field.name: SOD
field.description: Slave Output Disable. This bit is relevant only in slave mode (MS = 1). If it is 1, this blocks this SSP controller from driving the transmit data line (MISO).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: DR
register.description: Data Register. Writes fill the transmit FIFO, and reads empty the receive FIFO.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Write: software can write data to be sent in a future frame to this register whenever the TNF bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Tx FIFO is not full. If the Tx FIFO was previously empty and the SSP controller is not busy on the bus, transmission of the data will begin immediately. Otherwise the data written to this register will be sent as soon as all previous data has been sent (and received). If the data length is less than 16 bit, software must right-justify the data written to this register. Read: software can read data from this register whenever the RNE bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Rx FIFO is not empty. When software reads this register, the SSP controller returns data from the least recent frame in the Rx FIFO. If the data length is less than 16 bit, the data is right-justified in this field with higher order bits filled with 0s.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: TFE
field.description: Transmit FIFO Empty. This bit is 1 is the Transmit FIFO is empty, 0 if not.

field.name: TNF
field.description: Transmit FIFO Not Full. This bit is 0 if the Tx FIFO is full, 1 if not.

field.name: RNE
field.description: Receive FIFO Not Empty. This bit is 0 if the Receive FIFO is empty, 1 if not.

field.name: RFF
field.description: Receive FIFO Full. This bit is 1 if the Receive FIFO is full, 0 if not.

field.name: BSY
field.description: Busy. This bit is 0 if the SSP0 controller is idle, or 1 if it is currently sending/receiving a frame and/or the Tx FIFO is not empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: CPSDVSR
field.description: This even value between 2 and 254, by which SSP_PCLK is divided to yield the prescaler output clock. Bit 0 always reads as 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: IMSC
register.description: Interrupt Mask Set and Clear Register.

field.name: RORIM
field.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Overrun occurs, that is, when the Rx FIFO is full and another frame is completely received. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

field.name: RTIM
field.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Time-out condition occurs. A Receive Time-out occurs when the Rx FIFO is not empty, and no has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

field.name: RXIM
field.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

field.name: TXIM
field.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RORRIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

field.name: RTRIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, and has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

field.name: RXRIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

field.name: TXRIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RORMIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full, and this interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RTMIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, has not been read for a time-out period, and this interrupt is enabled. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

field.name: RXMIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full, and this interrupt is enabled.

field.name: TXMIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty, and this interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RORIC
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the frame was received when RxFIFO was full interrupt.

field.name: RTIC
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the Rx FIFO was not empty and has not been read-bit for a time-out period interrupt. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR x [SCR+1]).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: IC
register.description: Interrupt clear register for port n

field.name: CLR0
field.description: Selects interrupt on pin x to be cleared (x = 0 to 11). Clears the interrupt edge detection logic. This register is write-only. The synchronizer between the GPIO and the NVIC blocks causes a delay of 2 clocks. It is recommended to add two NOPs after the clear of the interrupt edge detection logic before the exit of the interrupt service routine. 0 = No effect. 1 = Clears edge detection logic for pin PIOn_x.

field.description: Selects interrupt on pin x to be cleared (x = 0 to 11). Clears the interrupt edge detection logic. This register is write-only. The synchronizer between the GPIO and the NVIC blocks causes a delay of 2 clocks. It is recommended to add two NOPs after the clear of the interrupt edge detection logic before the exit of the interrupt service routine. 0 = No effect. 1 = Clears edge detection logic for pin PIOn_x.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved
